file_content.text: If you want no further trouble, then get out now.
Look at what you've done. Is that the sign of a glorious Empire?
Hunn here. What do you need, Amber Cavern?
Hold on. How did you get in?
I have your people, I ask the questions.
I don't answer to rebels.
First I made some bodies, then I stepped over them.
The usual way. Violence.
What cause do you have to fight us? You're not regular army.
You know, what you rebels need to ask is, where can I not get in?
As if I'll tell you?
An Imperial, hmm. But not a grunt....
Your petty legions did not know the power of the Force. I educated them.
The Force opens all doors.
A Sith, eh? No one move. We... we might work this out.
A sorcerer. No one move. Do not give a Sith cause for anger.
My brilliant wit.
All right. I can take a hint.
Wrong. The question is, what am I going to do if you anger me?
I'll let you wonder.
Listen, the people in that complex aren't of any consequence and are certainly no threat to the Empire.
They have quite an escort for people of no military value. Try again.
Then why all the protection?
Lies.
I'm telling the truth! They're Force sensitives, and the law on Imperial planets is, all Force sensitives must be trained as Sith.
Don't make me show you what a threat is. Explain why they are in hiding, now.
I decide that.
If you're at all... you know, Force sensitive... you have to go to Korriban for Sith training.
If you don't train, you're executed as a potential threat. But not everyone would make it as a Sith.
Some people discover their sensitivity when they're too old, or they just don't have the will. So they go into hiding with us.
What would you do with these washouts?
And you don't train them?
What would anyone do? We take them to Republic planets, get them a job farming dirt or making hyperdrives or whatever.
That's not smart.
It may be difficult for you to understand, but we don't try to exploit these people.
One doesn't hear much about those weak in the Force.
An interesting failure.
Right. But it doesn't mean they deserve to be executed, or forced to stab each other in the back.
I can feel them reach out... but terror makes them unsteady. They grasp nothing.
They do feel weak.
That's what our Jedi thought. They can feel a little, but they're not worth training.
We get them to Republic planets so they can grow dirt or compose symphonies or whatever it is they're good at.
But the Emperor keeps making laws that say they have to die.
They do. And you're going to watch.
There are no exceptions.
You're a monster. And we're going to hunt you down like one.
If they are no threat, they have little to fear from me.
I will let them live.
Are you serious? Your superiors would... well, I won't tell them if you don't.
Everyone in that cavern will have you to thank for their lives.
We'll clear everyone out of the caves. It would be best if you could say you found nothing here.
There's an Imperial on viewscreen! Reinforcements to Amber Cavern, now!
